title: Kanarese (1906) New Testament
description:
The New Testament of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ was newly translated from the original Greek into Kanarese by a committee appointed by the Bangalore Auxiliary Bible Society 1891-1906.

Kanarese is modernly referred to as Kannada. These are some 66 percent of the inhabitants of Karnataka, in south-central India, who speak the Kannada language. In 1991 they numbered about 31 million speakers (four percent of the national population). The Kannada language belongs to the Dravidian family. It has an ancient, mainly devotional, literature, stretching back to the ninth century A . D . The Kannada script, though similar to that of Telugu, is only used for writing Kannada and the closely related languages Tulu and Kodagu, both of which are spoken in the western parts of Karnataka.
